newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Seoul stocks seen gaining on falling interest rate.
newsitem.headline: Seoul stocks seen gaining on falling interest rate.

text.p: Seoul stocks are expected to maintain their rally on Friday on the back of falling interest rates and hopes for an economic turnaround, brokers said.

"The market liquidity looks abundant, foreign investors are active and interest rates continue to fall," said Choi Dong-chul of Ssangyong Securities. "I expect active buying by domestic institutional investors."
Yields on three-year benchmark corporate bonds fell to 11.86 percent on Thursday.
The composite stock index closed on Thursday at 742.50, a new 1997 high.
Brokers forecast a mild intraday consolidation following recent sharp rises. But they said the correction would spur strong buying interest.
President Kim Young-sam is scheduled to give a televised address to the public on his 1992 election spending. But brokers said investors believed nothing substantial would be announced.
